page.title: 03TREWAVAS
page.content: Half a kilometre to the south-east of Rinsey Beach is Trewavas Head. From sea level to the top of the cliffs you can see the remains of mining- engine houses built into the cliff face and chimneys still standing. The main mine shaft has been capped for safety reasons but notices warn of the danger of open mine shafts. The land at the top of the cliff still shows the scars of its industrial past and tracks still lead to the nearest roadway which passes Trewavas Farm before joining the coast road to Porthleven.
